website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys E3000 is the first advanced router that's also easy to use for novices. It provides great wireless performance and has a good set of useful networking features. Its mediocre NAS performance and limited guest networking feature make it significantly less than perfect, however.
pros: The Linksys High Performance Wireless-N Router E3000 delivers most of what you'd expect from a high-end router, including true dual-band, Gigabit Ethernet, fast throughput, a long range, NAS functionality, a nice set of networking features, and a good Web interface
It also has an aesthetically pleasing compact design and an intuitive software application to help home users set up and manage a home wireless network with ease
cons: The Linksys E3000's built-in network storage function lacks speed, and its Guest networking feature is limited
It doesn't support USB printers, and its Media Server doesn't work well with large video files
The included desktop application can't be used with the router's Web interface

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had an old refurbished E3000 that worked (with DD-WRT) for several years. It died so I looked for a replacement that could also run DD-WRT. Unfortunately, many manufacturers keep modifying their products so that it's very difficult to know what version is shipping and whether it will work with DD-WRT. The E3000 has only one version and it works with DD-WRT. I was able to reflash it with no problem and it works great! The product came in original packaging with the standard accessories, instructions, and CD. Appearance very good without dents, scratches, or dust.
customer_reviews.author: Null

customer_reviews.title: Good product but old model, you can easily get a better & newer router for less now.
customer_reviews.text: Bought used because it was much cheaper back in 2014. At which point it was already a product that was at least 3 years old. it has lasted me about three years and today after a bit of researched I found it has been "bricked". Which basically means its fried I think. Had a bad storm here and I guess the power must have went out though wasn't at home at the time. Even though it was plugged into a surge protector it must have still been overloaded. Nothing wrong with it, not the fastest speeds but it worked well on 2 or 3 devices at a time. But it is time to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Austin White

customer_reviews.title: Bought refurbisheed, but barely works
customer_reviews.text: I can't get above 7Gbps on the WAN. I have a 25Gbps WAN connection and this just kills my speeds. I have an 8 year old dlink that handles my network better. The wireless radio also cuts out randomly for minutes at a time. I bought it refurbished, which was apparently not a good idea as testing should be part of the refurbishing process. I think what they meant was "used" instead. It came with ddwrt on it, which is fine, I would have done that anyway, but suggests to me that whoever sold it knew it wasn't working right and sold it. Very unhappy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Solid and reliable home office router
customer_reviews.text: The E3000 just works. I recommend technology for a number of remote workers all using a variety of resources from a central location including VoIP and this has become my go-to over the years as it just simply works, works well, and doesn't randomly flake out. The same can't be said for some of the other Linksys offerings. As all things go, the product line marches on and these stalwart units are replaced with newfangled ones that are supposed to better but are not.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Pro

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product but needs antennas
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure at first about buying this product having read other reviews about nightmare type hook-ups. Having owned an older Lynksys G system I decided to go fr it and am not sorry....Hook up was a breeze, especially if you follow the instructions. Also purchased the WET610N Video/Gaming Adapter to hook up to my Blue-Ray. The only shortfall on the E-3000 and others in this series is the built-in antenna..On my previous G model I installed a high gain antenna that Linksys sells. Wish this has external antenna so I could do the same. The range I am getting is not as good on this new model with internal antenna. But the speed is indeed far better with N.
customer_reviews.author: V. F. Scotto

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless router, but desktop software weak, and get's hot.
customer_reviews.text: Great router performance, but get's very hot and desktop software interface needs a bit of work. The heat problem is easily solved by putting 4 bottle caps under each corner for better airflow and cooling. Now the unit does not get as hot. As far as the desktop software called "Cisco Connect"- it's a nice feature for those who don't mess around with router settings. But pretty much useless for advanced users. For example if you decide you want to change some advanced settings by logging into the 192.168.1.1 web interface, the "cisco connect" interface will apparently become unusable- strange. Any way the performance of the router is great.
customer_reviews.author: proheart

customer_reviews.title: Range of router- is it worth it?
customer_reviews.text: This is a good router. Setup is trivial- run the CD, then plug in the router. 2.4 and 5 gHz setups are nicely separate- you can give each a different name, channel and configuration (if you want to). Question is- is this router really better than older or cheaper routers? I had the chance to replace an old Linksys 160, a Cisco 1000, and a Netgear WNDR 3700 with a Cisco E3000. The result: it is about 25% stronger than the 160 or the 1000, and maybe 10-15% stronger than the Netgear. This is with 2.4 gHz. Range was awful with both 5 gHz routers. It is just stronger enough to detect reliably with appropriate software.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Love this New Router!
customer_reviews.text: Only our 2nd WL Router and what a step up in Quality, speed and capabilities. Having 4 ports, USB port and the User friendly software setup is Great. The only thing that would help a new Cisco user is that they should tell you ahead of time to have a USB storage device, Mini drive or Memory card, ready & available to help make your "EASY SETUP KEY" file. (Part of Software install from Disk) It really comes in handy to setup your router on other pc's or Laptops instead of having the disc available every time. Nice looking unit and working great with high bandwith. Highly recommend this unit for quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Cisco - The Most Reliable Name in Connectivity Today!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome is the word for this router. Great range - easily reaching into my back yard ~100' away. Dual-band facilitates network speeds. Works all over the house with solid connections to a variety of mobile phones and laptop computers. One button connection to devices, printers and computers. Great for the non-techies out there. USB connection allows video server capability. Good software. Tech support outstanding. In a few words, you can't go wrong with Cisco routers. My strongest recommendation to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MikeM

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This router works as advertised. It was easy to set-up using a thumb drive. I was able to set-up 3 desktops and a laptop with almost no effort by using the initial installation on my main computer to create a setup program on the thumb drive as suggested by the Cisco install disk then inserting the thumb drive into each of the other computers. It recognized our smart phones and allowed guest to connect on a separate channel via a password I setup for guest. The range is excellent. I was able to get good connections from any room in the house, the main level, upstairs and the basement. It's a great purchase. CONS: Can't think of any.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Samuels Sr

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up
customer_reviews.text: Just unpacked and set this up to replace an older linksys. I upgraded to get the Network backup & storage feature and hopefully gain some speed. I've set up a dozen or more routers for friends over the years and THIS WAS ABSOLUTELY THE SIMPLEST INSTALL I've ever encountered. Use the disk, you don't even need to cable the computer to the router. I used the same network name and passwords as my old router so my wireless printer and all my devices connected as if nothing changed. There are still unknowns regarding speed, range etc. but my first impressions are excellent. Thanks Cisco/Linksys and as always AMAZON ROCKS!
customer_reviews.author: T-Mish

customer_reviews.title: Great router.
customer_reviews.text: The router works great. The performance, the range and the reliability are everything I've come to expect of Cisco. The feature set is great and everything works as promised. Important to note - the router can automatically choose the least used radio channels for best WiFi performance. Using the disk that comes with it for initial configuration is a bad idea if you know how to setup a router because it leaves you with things like the guest network that you cannot get rid of later (what is that for???), but it does leave you with a secure working setup and you don't have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: stan.ua

customer_reviews.title: Love Ciscos products
customer_reviews.text: This modem has all the bells and whistles a home owner needs for setting up a basic wireless network. I am advanced in network technology so I had to install a dd-wrt firmware on this sweet little baby. I like the usb port tried it out with my printer and external hard drive. Printer was easier to setup than the hard drive access. I recommend this for both entry and advanced (with dd-wrt installed) networks.
customer_reviews.author: chirper9

customer_reviews.title: Used and defective product
customer_reviews.text: it's labeled as new but when I installed it, it turned out to be "used". The network name is not default name and I was unable to link it to my computer because it's not the one it's initially linked to. I have to use its factory reset button to clear up before installation. It functions properly on the first day but the next day I have to reboot it to get it work. On the third day, a single reboot doesn't work. I ended up switching back my old router and applied for refund. The refund process is quite smooth. That's the only positive experience I got from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kuo L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a techie, just a regular home user, so can't comment on the technical details. I read lots of reviews before buying and was looking for a wireless N router to replace a G router. We'd also just moved and had the option to get internet through a cable company. We bought this to connect with the cable modem and to be able to use wireless throughout a 2 story house. We use both PC and MAC laptops. Setup was extremely easy as was setup on all the laptops. We have not found any connectivity issues throughout the house and speed seems very good. Works seamlessly with the cable modem.
customer_reviews.author: John Tanaka

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Setting up the E3000 was very easy with supplied software. It has just worked for the last four months. Used with both wired and wireless connections, no problems. Additional note: We have been using the router for about four months now, and it has been flawless. Recently added an entertainment system, and wireless performance was much better than I expected for streaming video. Excellent Gaming performance as well (or at least so my son tells me...). No problems at all, even when installing devices on the network that were not planned when I got the router. Just seamless reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Greybeard

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up. Range no better than my old G router
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Did not need USB key software to add other computers. Wireless setup easy as with most other routers. Nice design. I see absolutely no difference in range between this N router and my 3 year old G router. Extended range was the reason I bought this. Router in bedroom. Admittedly, signal has to go through 3 walls to reach living room, but I expected a better signal with an N router. Disappointed. I will have to wire the old router in the livingroom to create an access point, and, for me, that means crawling under house. That's what I wanted to avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Another Overpriced, Overhyped Loser from Cisco
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a second router for my mother-in-law because my router is fantastic. The wireless N is lighting fast. The range stinks. I cannot get a decent connection at the far side of my house. In fact, the signals from my neighbors' routers on each side are stronger than the signal from this router. The setup menus are adequate, they could be better. Now that it is on sale for half price, grab it before Amazon sells out, you'll be very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Solid product but the setup cd needs a lot of improvement.
customer_reviews.text: My network consists of a wide variety of devices, some new and some quite old. If you have all new hardware, the setup cd will probably be OK, but in retrospect I wish I had skipped it and just went straight to manual setup. I would have saved a lot of time. I do like the dual band setup options. I put the blue-ray player on the 5 GHz band and everything else on the 2.4 GHz. It works great--Netflix downloads noticeably faster and our laptops almost never drop a connection now. I've had the router about two months and would buy the same model again.
customer_reviews.author: rexntulsa

customer_reviews.title: Good luck with Firmware update
customer_reviews.text: I like this router overall but it runs very hot. I have a wired computer network and use this only for my laptop. Compared with my previous G setup, it's significantly faster. My laptop battery drains very quickly since the change. The coverage area is very good as well. I thought the setup was a little tough, though easier than any other wireless router i've installed. Someone not that good at computers would probably need help. The firmware update was hard. Be ready to wire your computer into the cable/dsl modem for online support.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Linksys WRT54G
customer_reviews.text: The main benefit of replacing my WRT54G with this router is that the speed seems faster on my hardwired computers. I bought this router to use two main features and found they worked great so far: 1. WPA and WPA2 'Mixed' mode AES encryption for my PSP, PS3, Tivo, Sony Laptop, Dell desktop, Blackberry 9700, Brother monochrome printer (HL-5370DW), and Samsung Eternity. 2. FTP server for a USB attached esternal hard drive (although there is no FTP/S). My wife accesses this from her work - nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jess W.

customer_reviews.title: Simply Excellent... performance and simplicity
customer_reviews.text: I bought one about 1 year ago. So far has work like the first day. The amazing thing about this reuter is that is so powerfull in its performance that you don't get slow connection never. Another thing is the configuration. I did it myself and that is a lot to say since I am not an expert in the matter. It doesn't get hot nor takes time for my laptop to get hooked wireless. I even configure a wireless cam to it and is like nothing happen. No slow performance. Connection is ver strong.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold J. Calderon

customer_reviews.title: No support,
customer_reviews.text: Router has worked fine for about 4 years, I never had an issue with it so I never bothered to check for updates. right now this router is acting very weird, dropping the signal, giving me the wrong subnet mast that is not configured 255.255.255.251 cannot figure this out so I go to the cisco website to update the router and there is no update since 2010. wow no support it did last 4 years with no issues
customer_reviews.author: Endi

customer_reviews.title: Problem to watch out for on E3000 setup
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to solve this problem and Linksys is of little support. I have an extensive home network with multiple PC's (wired and wireless) Media connected TV, Network drives, Tivo's and other connected items. After install all PC's could connect wired or wirelessly to the Internet but when I viewed my local network nothing showed up. No shares. Symptoms were different on XP, Vista and W7 PC's. After trying several things I decode to rename my workgroup on each PC' After renaming the workgroup to a new name on each PC everything worked. So if you have a home network with file and print sharing watch out for this setup problem.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hogan

customer_reviews.title: E3000
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought the e3000 I had the wireless G router by same maker. With the e3000 I have not lost a signal yet. It is able to keep up with several gaming consoles and computers without losing the signal strength. Set up was very easy on my part just place disk in and follow the directions. The only problem that I am having issues with is the connection of the external hard drive. The computer does not detect any external drives connected. Overall it is performing quiet well for now.
customer_reviews.author: CC1071

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to replace some a/b/g equipment as well as extend my network and provide a wired gigabit switch. I used manual setup to disable DHCP and set the network configurations to mimic what was in place. After some setup, everything provided a seamless and faster solution to my wireless devices. I am not using the USB connection so I can't comment on that operation. Solid and reliable -- that's what I was looking for and what I found with this product.
customer_reviews.author: wills_dad

customer_reviews.title: Linsky ease and range.
customer_reviews.text: The E3000 is super easy to set up with a WIRELESS computer.I could not talk to the linksy with my dell xps do to it not being wireless.And I needed to download drivers from the net through the linksy itself.So I popped the set up cd in my Qosmio and quickly had the wireless network up and automatically secured.Not to sure about the guest set up yet and will have to go back to the web site and learn some more.Otherwise it was painless to set up and a pleasant experience.Last time I hooked up a linksy I had to speak with someone in India who could only speak incoherent broken English.
customer_reviews.author: JJ422

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a very while
customer_reviews.text: It was super easy to install. Had it for a while (maybe 1 or 2 years) but stopped working. I really wish it lasted longer but overall it was good item.
customer_reviews.author: Sherzod Bek

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for a dual band router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router at ThanksGiving with a discounted price from a third party seller. The seller was excellent and prompt in delivery. My main usage was to replace my old linksys wire router as I have structural wiring at home. The router is performing very well (both wire and wirless) so far. Thanks to the wireless feature that I was able to use the HP TouchPad I bought later. It provides both a guest wireless and a master wireless accesses to the internet. I am very happy with this purchase and recommend this product to those who need a wired and wireless feature. I give it a 5-Star rating.
customer_reviews.author: SlyK

customer_reviews.title: Server Feature ! Yes please ...
customer_reviews.text: This router was bought for 3 reasons ... 1) IT's A LINKSYS AND YOU KNOW THAT MEANS QUALITY & RELIABILITY ! 2) The USB connection for server / storage support within your home / office network is to cool for you !!! You'll love it's convience and simplicity 3) It's ultra high speed transmission capability was a necessity as an upgrade with our new home network over my old 10/100 Linksys
customer_reviews.author: Skipster

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy from this seller!
customer_reviews.text: I knew that this device it had a bad reputation of overheating, I didn't mind that since I already had a fix for that; but I'm disappointed at the seller because the router wasn't working, there was only one working port (port#1) and the rest they are completely dead. That was my first and last time I buy from this place. I'll make sure to let everyone that I know not to buy from this place.
customer_reviews.author: sellbuygoodstuff

customer_reviews.title: User Friendly N-Router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to replace my old G-Router (Lynk-Sys) which was causing problems uploading movies from Netflix on my Wii as well as to improve the speed and range of the wireless internet access in our three floor home. This router hit the mark! I set it up in our basement in about 15 minutes total (including software download time) and we have coverage to the entire house. Best of all...no more screaming kids (and wife) when the movie freezes 10 minutes into the showing! I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Suarez

customer_reviews.title: I expected more from it
customer_reviews.text: Pro: It does it's job Speedy Easy to setup Easy to configure Con: Lack of some features (specially on guest accounts) Can't rename media server feature with special character (.,*,etc..) Bit pricy I always bought my network products from Cisco I got disappointed because even after install updated Firmware I still need to reboot this router once a week Wireless network gets stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Tche_leao

customer_reviews.title: Linksys E3000
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to replace a flaky Dell router. Setup was rapid and completely intuitive, and the device began working flawlessly immediately. A few days ago I was called to a meeting about a half-mile from my home and booted my laptop in preparation to connect to an unsecured local network. To my astonishment, my laptop connected to the Linksys at home with plenty of signal strength. I'm literally blown away by the astounding range of this device. I'd recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred A. Pease

customer_reviews.title: Great!! .....but....
customer_reviews.text: Great Router, Easy Setup, Great for streaming Movies & Gaming. But only issue is Range for some reason is not so far optimal, even though anywhere picked up does stream very well. Plus sometimes it Signal cuts out then comes right back on when streaming. So I've been told it's because the settings are default, which they are. But have no clue how to adjust it to be optimal. If any help, that would be sweet. But it IS a Great Router, for a decent price. ;0)
customer_reviews.author: MrViper

customer_reviews.title: Easiset Installation To Date
customer_reviews.text: I have owned other Linksys wireless routers and always found them difficult to setup. The helps here in Amazon reviews were the only way to get them to work right. Now with the E3000 router setup was very easy and quick. I was really impressed with the ease of installation and configuration. In only a matter of minutes I was able to setup the router and connect my iPod Touch and iPad to the WWW. I would recommend this router to anyone seeking to add WiFi at home. Setting up a secure connection was also very easy.
customer_reviews.author: mrksmpsn

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this unit for over 2 years under VERY heavy use and have never had a problem. I'm talking about 9 separate WiFi devices simultaneously running with a desktop surfing the net! So good, I bought another in case of trouble. I've never had to open the extra box!
customer_reviews.author: Jailer 58

customer_reviews.title: great router, I couldn't use the usb to attach ...
customer_reviews.text: great router, I couldn't use the usb to attach a usb hub and add more usb drives onto it.. but I search else where its more because it's not built for the purpose.. it requires some hacking to get it to work.. and I didn't bother.. as a router it's great.. the guest network is great feature to have too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome Setup for Guest WIFI but Once Completed Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This router has a lot of features, but unfortunately the set up application is lacking. As others have mentioned you can only set up the Guest WIFI using Cisco Connect software. So if you want to set any 'advanced' settings (such as QoS, port forwarding, DHCP reservations based on MAC address, DynDns, etc) AND if you Guest WIFI support then you need to set up Guest WIFI using the Connect software and then set up the rest using the web-based administrative interface. Once the set up was complete the router functions really well and I have had no problems with the 10s of devices that connect to it. The performance improvement from 802.11N and 1000Gbps is immediately noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Rajat

customer_reviews.title: Simple if you don't change what you don't understand
customer_reviews.text: I don't see the problem using their interface...it seems pretty secure. I'm running a home office with two servers. If you don't know what you're changing, the default setup is perfect - if you want to be extra secure, limit access by IP. Setting up a media share is simple. My only complaint would be the heat otherwise the device is pretty cool looking at least in an aesthetic way - and I guess it's practical if you mount it on a wall
customer_reviews.author: Free Radical

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on black friday for not much cheaper than what it is now. Setup took a total of 10 minutes. Also picked up the warranty because my last linksys, which I paid over $100 for, stopped working after about a year and a half. But so far I am impressed by this unit. The wifi is very strong. The unit is in the basement and I am able to get full reception 2 floors above. And if this router decides to stop working I have the warranty for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: J. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased that I bought the E3000. It replaced my old 802h linksys. The setup of the E3000 was very simple and straightforward. Once setup I easily connected our two mac books, the tivo, the vonage phone and not so easy was the wireless bother printer but in the end I got it working. I've had no problem for a couple of months now and the speed is noticeably faster. I just need to get the upgrade for the tivo now to take advantage.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Effective Overkill
customer_reviews.text: I have a long house and I keep the router in the kitchen. I bought this router because of the 6 internal antennas. The range of this router is the best I have experienced in this house. If this is an issue in your home, this is the router for you. The setup is easy for a novice. I don't need any of the advanced capability of this router but if I ever do I know that it's available. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. It is nice to have a wireless HP OfficeJet on the network. Using Cisco Network Magic Pro to allow wired and wireless devices-iPhone, iTouch, laptops, workstation, printers, USB external hard drive. Nice to set control of shared files. After several months this router has not dropped connections with all of these devices. My previous Belken wireless-N constantly dropped connections when multiple devices were added.
customer_reviews.author: cam

customer_reviews.title: Boom, very fast setup and speed
customer_reviews.text: I connected the router to modem and a power outlet, started the setup process and what? Boom, the setup was complete in less than 5 minutes. I was having difficulty having internet in my other rooms and with this router, now I get internet in all my rooms. I just had it up and running in the last few minutes, will update my review if I find anything new. I followed two of the instructions based on other reviews: 1. set up the CD and let it run ( 5 ft away from the router) 2. Don't change the userid and password during the initial setup. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Sudheer Bandaru

customer_reviews.title: Lynksys e3000
customer_reviews.text: Bought this wireless router along with a Lexmark Pro901 printer. Both work seamlessly together. The installation CD worked just fine for installing my original desktop computer with the router. Then made a key on a USB thumb drive that I used for other wireless computers and laptops in the home. This installation went very smooth and was really easy. Next added the wireless capability for the Lexmark printer. This was very simple with this router-printer combination. Lastly, I linked an iTouch up, also very easy. This router works very well and is much faster than my oder router and much more stable. Terrific upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: RJC

customer_reviews.title: Great Router has big foot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router but because it will not stand on edge, it has a BIG footprint which takes a lot of shelf space. The Guest access feature is nice because you can create a special password to grant temporary access to visitors without compromising your standard security. Overall I am very pleased with this wireless N router. We have two PCs hard-wired and two laptops running wireless. Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a lot of difference
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one, intending to replace a 5 year old linksys wrt54g. It turns out my old router had (marginally) better wifi range and coverage, so i'm returning this. That dealbreaker aside, the router comes with more features (ftp, media server, file server, etc) and probably gives better throughput when you are in range of its signal. I wish Linksys would also include an external antenna connector so those of us with difficult wifi environments can use their equipment.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ledesma

customer_reviews.title: Junk - with no customer support
customer_reviews.text: I went through 2 of these before giving up when they stopped offering tech support without charging for it. Both the units (the one I purchased and the one they sent me to replace it) worked fine for the first 2 months but then the signal they put out would start dropping out and get worse and worse until they were basically unusable. Utterly useless and given that Cisco don't stand behind these products, evidently even they think they make crap products. Their Indian tech support was horrible as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Cisco E3000 Honest Evaluation
customer_reviews.text: It was a little tricky to set up - but only the fact that it took me 3X longer than necessary. The setup program was good but if Cisco ever gets it right what they would do is work with focus groups of technical and non-technical people to perfect its user friendliness. Then maybe they would get a super home run. Good product. Fair setup experience. A little inconvienient but nothing to fear.
customer_reviews.author: Fredgear

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this router! I watched movies directly streaming from Netflix wirelessly to my TV using this router without any interruption. Of course, some times, it is a problem with Netflix rather than this router when the picture and sound quality of a movie are bad. It is an excellent router and easy to set-up and administer!
customer_reviews.author: Life_is_a_Choice

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: It seems Routers last about 2 yrs and I replaced my WRT350n with this one. Like most Linksys products I always use the browser interface to setup. This time I used the disk. You can't set MAC filtering etc thru this method. Conversely you can't set the Guest account thru browser... Makes you wonder what the engineers and software guys are thinking! The Router works great and was easy to setup...
customer_reviews.author: Grey Day

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wireless router! I've been a Linksys / Cisco fan for quite some time, and this router continues to garner my support for them. I love the customization security features available through the online interface. Setup is easy for multiple devices. This router has run 24/7 for several years without one single hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie

customer_reviews.title: Fast router
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with the router since my husband and I (and a Cisco tech guy) set this up - fast and reliable. However, it took forever to get it to work w time Warner cable. A big part of the time was spent with TW helpline - total waste of time. If you have trouble setting this up just call cisco. Their helpline answered quickly and got it set up. The fix was something we couldn't have done without their help desk. So be prepared to make the call if you have TW. The set up is what kept me from giving it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: SAH

customer_reviews.title: Overall this is a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Used this router for many years. I cannot complain about the performance. I did upgrade due to adding additional wireless cameras which need a stronger signal due to their distance from the router. Overall this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Normally like linksys but....
customer_reviews.text: this router randomly would drop the connection to everyone on the wifi. Wasn't sure what the issue was but sure enough when I bought a new wireless router (ASUS) it work without problems. That said in the past I had used some linksys routers and was pretty happy, I do feel that there are more options on the ASUS (like a wireless router to wireless router connection)
customer_reviews.author: B. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer. Key features not supported.
customer_reviews.text: Solid, stable. I've had this for a few years now and it seldom needs restarting. However, I will ding Cisco for dropping support for the app. Some features, such as control over the guest network, are not available via the remaining web interface.
customer_reviews.author: MindKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: cisco e3000
customer_reviews.text: This product is the best hotspots/router I have installed. It sensed my network configuration and applied the settings automatically. The only weaknesses I found were the inability to set up the wireless settings automatically from a wired connection as well as the fact that specific changes could only be done through software, not manually. Great speed and distance. No antenna connection.
customer_reviews.author: indyman777

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money.
customer_reviews.text: Superb router. Very easy to setup. Love the utility that comes with the unit. Provides the user some great flexibility in the way it can be configure. Signal strength does drop off outside of 100 feet otherwise it's perfomed flawlessly for the passed 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Francis X. Fanucci

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great for years and has a strong constant signal
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great for years and has a strong constant signal. I used it for my PS3 and gaming without any loss of connection. I also ran 3 computers off of this and the settings are easy to find and understand.
customer_reviews.author: hlucn8tn

customer_reviews.title: Weird requirements
customer_reviews.text: The killer feature going in was guest networking. Unfortunately the only way to configure it is using a Windows-only app. If you decide to use the tried and true Cisco "web interface" for configuring the router, you will blow away the guest networking settings. Meanwhile, all the advanced features are only accessible via web interface. So this became very difficult to configure and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Studious Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Router; No print server
customer_reviews.text: I have previous experience with Linksys routers and did not use the easy set-up cd. The router was very similar to my previous Linksys B router. At first the router did not recognize my 1.5 TB External Hard drive formatted as NTFS, but after I upgraded the firmware, the NAS worked just fine. The only thing lacking in this router is print server support for my old fashioned USB printer. However, we are just going to upgrade our printer to one with a built-in wireless print server. Overall, I'm pleased with the router.
customer_reviews.author: larkinrd

customer_reviews.title: Cisco still rules!
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking to upgrade my current Linksys cable modem/router (which I had for 4-5 years and virtually NEVER had a problem with it) to the newest wireless-N format and for some reason I decided to try something other than Cisco Linksys. After spending $200 + dollars and 3-4 weeks on 2 other routers from different manufacturers (with which I had numerous problems from setup thru maintaining a consistent connection) I bought this one. Set up was a breeze and once I maintained initial connections for all my devices throughout the house I haven't had a single router-related connection issue. And it wasn't much more expensive than the other lesser routers I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford L. Goodrich

customer_reviews.title: Decent router with pretty stable performance.
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through several router over the years and this on has been the best so far. The wireless some times has issues but seems all routers do at one time or another. Hard to tell if it's my service provider or the router at times but it has been one or the other but a power cycle usually fixes the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cp

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and reliable performance
customer_reviews.text: Router has been in operation for a month - fixed all problems with dropped internet connections and interference with other household appliances which plagued former Dlink system. Besides entering the static IP configuration for my service provider, I used the supplied 'auto' setup procedure which was very easy; wrote the setup configuration to a flash drive and had all my systems (2 desktop PCs, 4 laptop PCs and 1 Macbook) online within an hour. Connecting a PS3 only required it to rescan for the wireless network and enter the new wireless security key. Since I didn't have any problems with setup, this review may be too informative; even the name selected for the local network SSID fit my locale.
customer_reviews.author: D. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Strong Product
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to update the the router for the family while I am at home from the current, Comcast supplied Netgear router. The price and reviews on the E3000 were too good to pass up so I went with this model. Currently, I am still using the stock firmware and she is rock solid. I do plan on switching over to tomato and the near future to run a VPN. Perhaps I will update with my experiences after that. The router does run a tad on the warm side but this does not affect performance as the only times the router has been restarted are the last two power outages during wind storms.
customer_reviews.author: Jufluco

customer_reviews.title: Linksys E3000 had some problems, but not too bad.
customer_reviews.text: Linksys E3000 had some problems, but not too bad. The overheating problem was present. But I put the unit on top of one of those laptop coolers and it worked great with no more problems. E-3000 looks great and has quite a few ports for other internet connectsions
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: Most Undependable Router Ever
customer_reviews.text: While this thing boasts great features...it has single handedly destroyed my faith in linksys-cisco. This router worked great for about the first couple of weeks and from then on it's been nothing but dropped connections and problems with wireless clients. I've used this router for several months at this point. I continued to blame the problems on other points of failure but the truth of the matter is it just is just a sub-par piece of equipment. This thing has overheating issues like crazy and only works when it wants to. I plugged in an equivalent Netgear router today and all my problems are solved. Think twice before buying this piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Chad C.

customer_reviews.title: Great router. I have two of them
customer_reviews.text: Great router. I have two of them. They are reliable. Great speed. I never needed the variable speed router with up to 10 kids using cell phones, a PS3 and two PCs connected to the router. The E3000 Maintained high speed on all devices at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Dianes Dad

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup without CCC
customer_reviews.text: Advanced setup was easy using web interface recommend not installing CCC software (no need).. Unit does get warm.. have angled it upright at 45 degrees and heat problem is gone with 5 bars 144 Mbps. Guest user not configurable from web interface, (strange) but knew that pre-purchase. Have always had good luck with Linksys. we'll see..
customer_reviews.author: J.W.B.

customer_reviews.title: Working as expected
customer_reviews.text: After a less than stellar experience with a D-Link wireless N router that gave me nothing but connection problems and forced me to disconnect it in order to use my Xbox, I bought the E3000 and have been extremely happy with the purchase. I utilize both g and n wireless networks, and my Xbox worked without any issues while connected. My past experience with Linksys has been positive, I should have stayed with them instead of trying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: AaronMN

customer_reviews.title: must own router
customer_reviews.text: i have to be brief .. this router is one of the best LINKSYS ever .. set up was 7 minutes and the signal dramatically or significantly changed!!!! i will highly recommend this router.. my wrt54gs just slow down and a lot of disconnection... you will not regret if you get this router.. move on and get this!!!!
customer_reviews.author: manny  pagz

customer_reviews.title: Great one, better than the newer 3200 model
customer_reviews.text: I had two of this one, and they are great. Very performant router and smart (you can plug it to modem or another internet connection and it will do the right thing). BTW, I had a very bad experience with the newer model, e3200 which drop packets or something (could not watch video continuously and was slow). Jeremy,
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Chone

customer_reviews.title: Great product could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to set up, but you are required to use the Cisco software if you want to set up the "guest" access. This is not configurable in the advanced configuration internal webpage. The USB storage access works, but not under heavy load. I lost connection streaming music through it several times. Casual file backups not a problem. Did like the ability to set up individual shares and user access.
customer_reviews.author: JerryS

customer_reviews.title: Tank
customer_reviews.text: This router installed just great with no effort. The range is excellent. When I was experiencing difficulty getting my new wireless blue ray player through the router onto the internet, I called Tech Support. What a joke! Rude and helpless. Linksys Tech Support blamed it all on LG. I finally was successful with the router by speaking to LG Tech Support.
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: an excellent product with a outstanding service
customer_reviews.text: Just follow instructions on Cisco Connect and everything will be all right. One thing I need to search the forum is connecting my Sony BDP-S570 Bluray with this, and I've used the WiFi Protected with PIN number method and it worked wonderful. I'd like to recommend this product to everyone who want to build a wireless home network.
customer_reviews.author: loiquan

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I have had no issues with this router. I like the guest network piece of it. Security is easy. Connect a storage device. Download the free app and manage from your phone. Set the timer and turn off the net (by device if needed) so they kids get their chores done.
customer_reviews.author: Goodie

customer_reviews.title: Router performed as expected with great wireless performance
customer_reviews.text: Router performed as expected with great wireless performance. Simple upgrade if you are on existing Linksys router. Product delivery was on time with fast prime delivery but can likely be found for cheaper
customer_reviews.author: PeterM

customer_reviews.title: Same old same old... but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to help extend the wireless signal in our home (to help our iPads), not because I needed new features or a new router. It seems to have accomplished this, but not as much as I would have hoped. One issue I have is about once a week I start to get exactly half the speed I should get with my ISP. A reboot of the router fixes this every time. I would be curious if anyone else has this issue or maybe I have a bad router. I have 3 other linksys routers and none of them have ever or currently exhibit this. Cisco's support page is horribly lacking.
customer_reviews.author: gnomehole

customer_reviews.title: Good Router!
customer_reviews.text: This device works great, easy configuration, good design layout, fast operation are some of the attributes more important of this device. I like how this router applies its configuration inmediatly, with not failures, also the USB to attach an External HardDisk is very useful. I have some problems using the 5Ghz frequency, seems my wireless card doesn't support this standard, but I am not quite sure about that so far. I will get back to this comment as soon as the issue is resolved!
customer_reviews.author: Caciagli

customer_reviews.title: Linksys E3000 setup  & Operation
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the Cisco-Linksys E3000 high performance router from AMAZON.COM, I proceeded to set it up. I attached an ethernet cable between my Dell desk top computer to one of the ethernet connection inputs, inserted the Linksys setup disc in the PC and followed the prompts. Set up was very easy. I then followed the prompts to add my Samsung BD3600 Bluray player wirelessly and got it communicating within 20 minutes. I now watch NETFLIX wirelessly. Setup was not as complicated as I thought it would be and signal strength is strong. Everything is working as expected.
customer_reviews.author: eugand9753

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: This router worked right out of the box. I followed the instructions, installed the software before plugging in the router, updated the firmware, and setup both bands to have the same name and be auto configured. I get great range (better than with my previous wireless g router) and faster connections all over my house. I did not experience any of the problems others have reported. We have a lot of wireless routers around our house (15+ networks visible at any one time) and other cheaper routers would sometimes get drowned out and drop our connection. This one has been rock solid since we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Range and Speed
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to replace my current N-type router and use it as an access point. My house is so long, I haven't been able to find one router to conver the whole house. However, this router reaches everywhere. What's more it is FAST! I read about the limited hard drive features, etc., but that is not what I was looking for, so this works great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Coach

customer_reviews.title: Wireless network
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of homework researching wireless N routers, and decided I would go with this, and I am certainly happy that I did. It was extremely easy to set up, no problem. Everything has worked as it should, and receiving the service that I hoped I would. I most definitely would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best Router I have used in quite a while
customer_reviews.text: This router works perfectly. We are able to have two wireless networks in our house, one for 802N and one for 802G. This really speeds up transmits for the newer laptops. The attached storage setup is really easy and has been working flawlessly. I highly recommend this router to anyone who has an intermediate understanding of network installation.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Does not work properly with my Eee notebook
customer_reviews.text: My Asus Eee notebook will connect with other wireless n routers at 150Mbps, but will not connect with this one at more than 65Mbps. I sent the first one back in hopes that it was a problem with that particular router, but the replacement also will not connect with my Eee at over 65Mbps. After hours on chat sessions with Linksys and a long time on the phone with them, and after discussions with Asus online and on the phone, no one could come up with a solution that worked, so I must conclude that for some reason this router and my notebook are incompatible, and that I will have to send it back and get something different.
customer_reviews.author: Bob. Gould

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful router
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and setup. Works great with other systems and helps setup other computers on your network by creating and using a USB key. Setting up the internet bridge was a little tricky but that has to do more with the provider than it does with the router. Straight forward controls.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Philips

customer_reviews.title: I have had this router for 4 years being used ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router for 4 years being used all day and I have never had any issues with it. If something happens to this router I will just buy this one again if they still make it.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Just Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have never set up a Wifi anything in my life, but this was so easy and reliable that I had to say something good about this product. The box just comes with the router and a CD, the set up was fast and the signal is strong. Now I have Netflix in the living room while surfing on my laptop and someone else using the desktop, all at the same time! I have had the router for 3 months now and no kinks, yet.
customer_reviews.author: Big_Jon

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Fast
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th router. All of the others are excellent at one thing and poor at another. This one is the best all around router I've used. It finds my multimeadia servers, PS3, DVR2 and the WII plus the routine wireless printres, iPhone etc. It is dual band wireless N 300MIPS 5.8 and 2.4
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: doesn't mesure up to the hype, poor range
customer_reviews.text: The product is ok for computors although it's range is about one half what I expected from the research I did. For streaming other apps like netflix or pandora it is somewhat problematic and disapointing in speed and performance especially considering I have a 16 gig isp connection.
customer_reviews.author: xrider

customer_reviews.title: A very good router!
customer_reviews.text: This router has excellent security features, including "guest" frequency and access code. It has good signal strength, and it is easy to reboot on the rare occasions when there's a need to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Boiler59

customer_reviews.title: So Simple, awesome connection speed
customer_reviews.text: Simple and quick to setup. Connection speed is awesome. The only drawback is the low profile design which causes the unit to heat up. I just followed the advice in an earlier review and turned it upside down! doesn't look as sleek now but works for my purpose!
customer_reviews.author: F. Khalil

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Timely service as well a delivery. What exactly what was explained in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Whistine

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced a G router I had. Set up easy. The router "found" all my equipment no problem at all. I didn't have any of the problems I read about in other reviews. As I didn't have to use tech support I didn't rate it. I'm totally pleased with the 3000.
customer_reviews.author: John Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Thumb up!
customer_reviews.text: Very decent device! I have been using it for 4 years! I had to restart it maybe 3 or 4 times in 4 years but other then that not a single glitch.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nice Router
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Good performance. No complaints. I replaced a Netgear FVL 328 and a linksys wireless access point with one device that has all the features combined. Makes for a nice clean installation with enhanced performace. I especially like the Cisco Connect software that makes management of clients very easy.
customer_reviews.author: BlindSquirrel

customer_reviews.title: Very Please I got this router
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this router because my last router was a linksys and it sucked and the tech support was horrible. However, this one was extremely easy to set up. I hooked it up to comcast cable Internet modem in under 2 mintues and then hooked it up wireless to my blueray player that supports Netflix download movie streaming and wow, what a different. The Netflix movies streaming now look almost as nice as Blueray. Very happy I got this router!!!
customer_reviews.author: lucidbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Cisco-Linksys E3000
customer_reviews.text: 1. Best price 2. Delivered quick, everything in tact 3. Everything arrived in box, nothing missing 4. Setup easy in mixed Windows network: XP; Vista; Win 7 5. Noticeable performance improvement 6. Documentation fine 7. Rated Tech Support a 5, even though not contacted, could not find a NA rating 8. After 1 month usage ... good purchase, pleased with performance Jim Farmington Hills, MI
customer_reviews.author: James R. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Best Router by Linksys Yet!
customer_reviews.text: The router was very easy to set up. It has double the bandwidth over it's predecesor which means no more choppy video when my 11 year old is streaming videos from the internet. I get a full 300mbps from the 5ghz band with better coverage. This router was worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Garry W. Joerger

product_meta.title: Cisco-Linksys E3000 Wireless-N Router
product_meta.description:
The Linksys E3000 is a powerful dual-band Wireless-N router optimized for wireless entertainment. Connect your Blu-ray players, DVRs, and gaming consoles, and enjoy the smoother and faster HD video streaming and wireless gaming performance that simultaneous dual-band technology enables. A built-in USB port and UPnP AV media server let you share files over your network, as well as stream media content to an Xbox 360, PS3, or other compatible device. Plus, included Cisco Connect software gets you set up in a few simple steps and offers powerful tools for managing your wireless network.

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

INTRODUCING THE LINKSYS E3000



The Linksys E-Series routers combine sleek, modern styling with powerful Wi-Fi technology (see larger image). The Linksys E3000 is a powerful dual-band Wireless-N router optimized for wireless entertainment. Connect your Blu-ray players, DVRs, and gaming consoles, and enjoy the smoother and faster HD video streaming and wireless gaming performance that simultaneous dual-band technology enables. A built-in USB port and UPnP AV media server let you share files over your network, as well as stream media content to an Xbox 360, PS3, or other compatible device. Plus, included Cisco Connect software gets you set up in a few simple steps and offers powerful tools for managing your wireless network. The Linksys E-Series includes the E1000, E2000, and E3000 Wireless-N routers--check out a comparison chart of these three models. Additionally, the E-Series offers the customizable, Linux-based E2100L router and the AE1000 Wireless-N Adapter for use with non-wireless desktop and laptop PC computers.

KEY FEATURES
 * Enjoy the power of high-performance Wireless-N technology--optimized for wireless entertainment. 
 * Connect your computers, gaming consoles, Internet-enabled HDTVs and Blu-ray players, and other wireless devices at up to 300 Mbps of transfer speeds. 
 * Enjoy the benefits of simultaneous dual-band (2.4 GHz and 5 GHz), including smoother HD video streaming, wireless gaming and file transfers. 
 * Share your files at home or on the Internet by connecting a storage device to the Linksys E3000's built-in USB port. 
 * Stream video and media content via a built-in UPnP AV media server to an Xbox 360, PS3, or other compatible device. 
 * Use four Gigabit Ethernet (10/100/1000 Mbps) ports for faster file sharing with other Gigabit-enabled devices, including computers, hard drives, and servers. 
 * Set up your wireless network in a few simple steps using included Cisco Connect software. 
 *  Keep Wi-Fi freeloaders and Internet threats at bay with customizable security settings, including WPA/WPA2 Personal and SPI firewall protection.
   
   
 * Give visitors password-protected Internet access on a separate network--so your visitors have access to the Internet, but not your computers or data. 
 * Use Cisco Connect's Parental Controls to block specific websites and restrict Internet access during certain hours. 
 * Customize your network using easily accessible Advanced Settings. 

SIMULTANEOUS DUAL-BAND
The Linksys E3000 has double the bandwidth for smoother and faster HD video streaming, file transfers, and gaming. Connect other computers and devices to the Internet and each other at N speeds in both the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands. Simultaneous wireless bands help you avoid network interference. Use the 2.4 GHz band for surfing and e-mails and the less crowded 5 GHz band for time-critical entertainment. 
BUILT FOR ENTERTAINMENT

Simultaneous dual-band Wireless-N technology means smoother HD video streaming and faster gaming. A built-in USB port and UPnP AV media server let you share files over your network, as well as stream music, video, and photos to an Xbox 360, PS3, or other compatible device. Four Gigabit Ethernet ports enable faster file transfers with other Gigabit devices. The Linksys E3000 is an optimal choice for enjoying wireless entertainment at home. 

Cisco Connect screenshots (see larger image). QUICK TO INSTALL
Cisco Connect software, included with the Linksys E3000, gets your wireless network set up and ready to go in just a few simple steps. Insert the Linksys E3000 CD, run through a few screens, and you're ready to go within minutes. You'll quickly be sharing your home's Internet connection with your family's other computers and devices and experiencing the incredible performance of Wireless-N. You can also easily access Advanced Settings to customize your preferences. 
YOU'RE IN CONTROL

Cisco Connect software helps you personalize your settings and quickly add multiple Internet-enabled devices to your network. Use Parental Controls to restrict web usage during certain times and to block unwanted sites; plus customize these Parental Controls by device. Cisco Connect also lets you quickly and easily give password-protected Internet access to visitors while keeping your family's personal information private. With Cisco Connect, you're in control. 
STATE-OF-THE-ART SECURITY

Keep Wi-Fi freeloaders and Internet threats at bay with customizable security settings. All Linksys E-Series routers have advanced WPA/WPA2 wireless security and SPI firewall protection, which are designed to safeguard your home network and computers from most Internet attacks and help protect your data and privacy. Advanced users can access the browser-based utility to further configure the router's security settings. 

You get four Gigabit Ethernet ports plus a USB port and built-in UPnP AV media server (see larger image). 

The front of the E3000 (see larger image). OTHER LINKSYS PRODUCTS
Linksys E1000  * Enjoy the benefits of Wireless-N in your home--ideal for wireless Internet usage and home office productivity.
 * Connect your computers, wireless printers, smartphones, and other wireless devices at up to 300 Mbps of transfer speed.
 * Use four Fast Ethernet (10/100 Mbps) ports to directly connect wired devices.

Linksys E2000  * Connect your computers, gaming consoles, Internet-enabled HDTVs and Blu-ray players, and other wireless devices at up to 300 Mbps of transfer speeds.
 * Use four Gigabit Ethernet (10/100/1000 Mbps) ports for faster file sharing with other Gigabit-enabled devices, including computers, hard drives, and servers.
 * Utilize selectable dual-band (2.4 GHz or 5 GHz) to avoid interference on your network, allowing for smoother file transfers and media streaming.

Linksys E2100L  * Utilize the built-in Linux operating system to use additional customization options. 
 * Enjoy the benefits of advanced Wireless-N technology--connect your computers, gaming consoles, and other wireless devices at up to 300 Mbps of transfer speeds. 
 * Use four Fast Ethernet (10/100 Mbps) ports to directly connect wired devices. 
 * Stream video and media content via a built-in UPnP AV media server to an Xbox 360, PS3, or other compatible device.
 * Includes detachable antennas. 

Linksys AE1000  * Provide Wireless-N capability to your Windows desktop computers and laptops.
 * Enjoy the flexibility of selectable dual-band Wireless-N--connect to either a 2.4 GHz or 5 GHz wireless network.
 * Set up your Adapter in a few easy steps with the included software's simple setup wizard.



See more

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars726 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
